string.name: what
string.br: \tCoronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus.\n\n
\tMost people infected with the COVID-19 virus will experience mild to moderate respiratory illness and recover without requiring special treatment.\n\n
\tOlder people, and those with underlying medical problems like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer are more likely to develop serious illness.\n\n
\tThe best way to prevent and slow down transmission is be well informed about the COVID-19 virus, the disease it causes and how it spreads.\n\n
\tProtect yourself and others from infection by washing your hands or using an alcohol based rub frequently and not touching your face.\n\n

\tThe COVID-19 virus spreads primarily through droplets of saliva or discharge from the nose when an infected person coughs or sneezes, so it’s important that you also practice respiratory etiquette (for example, by coughing into a flexed elbow).\n\n

\tAt this time, there are no specific vaccines or treatments for COVID-19. However, there are many ongoing clinical trials evaluating potential treatments. WHO will continue to provide updated information as soon as clinical findings become available.\n\n

string.name: st2
string.br: \tCOVID-19 affects different people in different ways.Most infected people will develop mild to moderate illness and recover without hospitalization.\n

string.name: st6
string.br: \t7.A rash on skin, or discolouration of fingers or toes\n

string.name: st8
string.br: \tSeek immediate medical attention if you have serious symptoms. Always call before visiting your doctor or health facility.\n\n
\tPeople with mild symptoms who are otherwise healthy should manage their symptoms at home.\n\n
\tOn average it takes 5–6 days from when someone is infected with the virus for symptoms to show, however it can take up to 14 days.\n\n

string.name: aboutt
string.br: \tTo help the people to fight against Novel CoronaVirus (Covid 19). This Application contains few tips for prevention and suggestion to survive from CoronaVirus.\n
